title: 3 dead, 2 injured in shooting at Berrien County courthouse
content:
UPDATE: Inmate's fight with deputies led to fatal courthouse shootings
ST. JOSEPH, MI -- Two Berrien County courthouse employees and an inmate are dead after a shooting that occurred at the court Monday afternoon.
A sheriff's deputy and a civilian were also wounded in the 2:15 p.m. shooting and are in stable condition at an area hospital, authorities said.
Berrien County Sheriff Paul Bailey said the male inmate who allegedly opened fire on the victims was shot and killed by a deputy.
"We don't have all the details about what happened, what occurred and how he got the weapon," Bailey said during a press conference.
The employees killed were bailiffs for the court at 811 Port St. in St. Joseph.
The courthouse has been secured.
The wounded deputy is hospitalized at Lakeland Regional Hospital in St. Joseph.
Authorities expect to release more information at a 6 p.m. press conference.
"We ask for people to pray for the families of the deceased," Bailey said.
State police, Berrien County sheriff's authorities, St. Joseph police and the FBI are handling the investigation.
